title.narrative: UNDP Transitional support Human Rights Yemen

description.narrative: Projektet syftar till att stärka arbetet för de mänskliga rättigheterna under transitionsperioden i Jemen, genom att stödja etableringen av en oberoende nationell mänskliga rättigheters-institution, utveckla civila samhällets kapacitet att arbeta med mänskliga rättigheter, och stödja ministeriet för Mänskliga Rättigheter för att effektivt kunna bidra till

The project aims to support the strengthening of Human Rights during the Transition Period in Yemen through the establishment of an independent National Human Rights Body; the development of Civil Society Capacities in Human Rights; and support to the Ministry of Human Rights to effectively contribute to the transitional process.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The project aimed to 1) establish an independent National Human Rights Institution (INHRI) and building both the institutional capacity and the human capital of the institution, 2) support the Ministry of Human Rights to lead the process of human rights transition, human rights reporting and the establishment of an INHRI, and 3) support the civil society capacity. A major result that was achieved was the development of a draft law on establishing of an Independent National Human Rights Institution in consultation with many civil society organisations. The draft law was approved by the Council of Ministers with minor changes and referred to the Parliament. Thereafter the political situation deteriorated which also resulted in parliament being in recess for most of 2014 and beyond. Therefore the law was never adopted. However once the situations allows, there is a draft to revisit and adopt. Also support was provided to the Ministry of Human Rights which led to improved reporting to UN mechanisms, orientation on UN systems on human rights, reporting based on complaints received, advocacy including on issues such as women rights. The project has contributed to improved relationship between the Ministry and civil society organisations. It has also resulted in a draft human rights strategy and action plan in consultation with civil society organisations.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
